item.title: Miss add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Miss add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Miss add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Miss add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Miss add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Miss add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "Maybe you think you’ll be entitled to more happiness later by forgoing all of it now, but it doesn’t work that way. Happiness takes as much practice as unhappiness does. It’s by living that you live more. By waiting you wait more. Every waiting day makes your life a little less. Every lonely day makes you a little smaller. Every day you put off your life makes you less capable of living it." -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Miss add a quote by Lev Grossman
item.description:
"I have a little theory that I'd like to air here, if I may. What is it that you think makes you magicians?" More silence. Fogg was well into rhetorical-question territory now anyway. He spoke more softly. "Is it because you are intelligent? Is it because you are brave and good? Is is because you're special?
Maybe. Who knows. But I'll tell you something: I think you're magicians because you're unhappy. A magician is strong because he feels pain. He feels the difference between what the world is and what he would make of it. Or what did you think that stuff in your chest was? A magician is strong because he hurts more than others. His wound is his strength.
Most people carry that pain around inside them their whole lives, until they kill the pain by other means, or until it kills them. But you, my friends, you found another way: a way to use the pain. To burn it as fuel, for light and warmth. You have learned to break the world that has tried to break you." -- Lev Grossman

item.title: Miss add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description:
"But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness, I want sin.'
'In fact,' said Mustapha Mond, 'you're claiming the right to be unhappy.'
'All right then,' said the Savage defiantly, 'I'm claiming the right to be unhappy.'
'Not to mention the right to grow old and ugly and impotent; the right to have syphilis and cancer; the right to have too little to eat; the right to be lousy; the right to live in constant apprehension of what may happen tomorrow; the right to catch typhoid; the right to be tortured by unspeakable pains of every kind.' There was a long silence.
'I claim them all,' said the Savage at last.
Mustapha Mond shrugged his shoulders. 'You're welcome," he said." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sri S. Satchidananda
item.description: "If you have done something meritorious, you experience pleasure and happiness; if wrong things, suffering. A happy or unhappy life is your own creation. Nobody else is responsible. If you remember this, you won’t find fault with anybody. You are your own best friend as well as your worst enemy. (99)" -- Sri S. Satchidananda

item.title: Miss add a quote by David Martin Lloyd-Jones
item.description: "Have you realized that most of your unhappiness in life is due to the fact that you are listening to yourself instead of talking to yourself?" -- David Martin Lloyd-Jones

item.title: Miss add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "(An unhappy childhood was not) an unsuitable preparation for my future, in that it demanded a constant wariness, the habit of observation, and the attendance on moods and tempers; the noting of discrepancies between speech and action; a certain reserve of demeanour; and automatic suspicion of sudden favours." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Sex appeal is fifty percent what you've got and fifty percent what people think you've got." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "I've never tried to block out the memories of the past, even though some are painful. I don't understand people who hide from their past. Everything you live through helps to make you the person you are now." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "A woman's dress should be like a barbed-wire fence: serving its purpose without obstructing the view." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Nothing makes a woman more beautiful than the belief that she is beautiful." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Everything you see I owe to spaghetti." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "If you haven't cried, your eyes cannot be beautiful" -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. That is why some people with mediocre talent, but with great inner drive, go so much further than people with vastly superior talent. " -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "After all these years, I am still involved in the process of self-discovery. It's better to explore life and make mistakes than to play it safe. Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. You are connected to your child and to all those who touch your lives. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Miss add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde
